comments.body: So, `++` exists only at `scala-2.12`. We are using the underlying `concat` via alias `++`?

It still exists in 2.13, it just can't be overridden. It's an alias for `concat`:
`@inline final def ++ (that: collection.IterableOnce[A]): C = concat(that)`
The methods the collection has to implement in 2.13 to support addition are different, like `incl`.
